page.title: 18B and B:The Deverills
page.content: Just before the cross roads at {Longbridge Deverill}is a lovely old stone farmhouse built at the time of {Queen Anne.}It has a Georgian extension but about 15 years ago it was in such a state of disrepair that the Longleat Estate sold it and built a new farmhouse. It is now beautifully renovated and still has its old flag-stone floors, low-beamed ceilings and huge wooden doors. Now it has a Bed and Breakfast sign outside. Visitors to the village include Americans, French, Germans and Italians. Other visitors include Civil Servants, Inspectors for the Fish Farm and surrounding farms. The new owner speaks six languages and finds this very useful for his overseas guests. He has lived in many parts of the world and settled here because it is such a beautiful area.
